newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline ends steady to firm on tight barges.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline ends steady to firm on tight barges.

text.p: NWE gasoline prices ended steady to slightly higher on the back of continued tightness in barges and steady futures prices, traders said.

Eurograde barges finished in a wide range between $188 and $192 fob ARA with some very prompt interest for Rotterdam refinery barrels at higher levels, near $193 to $195, they said. Regular unleaded found sellers at $184 fob ARA, down about $2 from Wednesday.
Premium unleaded cargoes were assessed at $183-$184 fob and $193-$195 cif, traders said, in little discussion.
"I think we should not take too seriously (those higher numbers)," a barge trader in Germany said. "It's obviously very specific and does not fit into the real market."
He said that despite a closed arbitrage to the States, there were very few prompt cargoes on offer in Northwest Europe, with sellers looking to the end of June and early July.
"After this tremendous fall within three or four working days, it was time really for it to hold," he said. "It's not improving but it's not going down either."
-- John Hanley, London Newsroom +44 171 542 8185 (c) Reuters Limited 1997
